description: See the etymology of the corresponding lemma form.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of remerge (“to merge again”)
examples: In other words, appositives are merged within the core, but remerged to a peripheral position [...]

description: See the etymology of the corresponding lemma form.

entries.meaning: (uncommon) simple past tense and past participle of remerge (“alternative form of reemerge”)
examples: The countries of Central and Eastern Europe once again found their independence, Russia remerged from its long hybernation[sic], and the Republics of Central Asia found themselves as newly independent states.
